agreement_fields.description: Manufacturer or contractor that this agreement is signed with.
If this agreement is a sub agreement, this references the master agreement (must already exist).
Type of license agreement. Allowed values: SOFTWARE, MAINTENANCE, SUPPORT, PURCHASE, ORACLE, OTHER.
Enable automatic upgrade for licenses attached to this agreement.
If set to YES, attached licenses will be invalid when the agreement expires.
The date from which this agreement is valid.
The date to which this agreement is valid.
Legal organization that signed this agreement.
Restrict access according to organization setting.
Import data to existing agreement custom fields. Supported data types: Text, Date, Yes|No, Digit, Currency, Decimal.

license_fields.description: ID of an existing license to be updated. Required for license updates.
Name of an existing application.
SKU number of an existing application. If the SKU is not in the database, the license purchase will be imported as incomplete.
Legal organization that made the purchase. Required to get complete status.
Date of purchase. Required to get complete status. Supported formats: dd/MM/yyyy, MM/dd/yyyy, dd-MM-yyyy, yyyy/MM/dd, yyyy-MM-dd.
The unit of measurement for the license. An empty value marks the purchase as incomplete.
Information on how a license is assigned. Allowed values: Organization, Computer/datacenter, User, Site.
Defines if the license is an upgrade license. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
ID of the license to upgrade from. Required if 'Is upgrade' is set to YES.
Number of base licenses to upgrade.
Number of licenses. Required to get complete status.
Start of the subscription period. Required if 'Is subscription' is set to YES.
End of the subscription period. Required if 'Is subscription' is set to YES.
Defines if it is a subscription license. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
Value of the license purchase.
Currency of the license purchase.
Right to use the same and/or lower editions of the product. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
Right to use the lower product version of the product. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
Activates auto allocation. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
Defines whether a maintenance agreement includes upgrade rights. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
Defines whether automatic upgrade uses agreement period. Allowed values: YES, 1, True or NO, 0, False.
Date from which automatic upgrade is valid. Required if 'Maintenance according to agreement' is set to NO.
Date until which automatic upgrade is valid.
An external agreement number. Must exist before the license import. The purchase date must be within the agreement period.
ID from an external system such as ERP, CRM, or sales/order systems.
Name of the vendor or reseller from whom the license was purchased.
Location where proof of license purchase is stored.
Enter license purchase-specific information as free text.
Serial numbers or license keys received for this purchase.
Location where installation media is stored.
Invoice reference number found on the invoice.
Use the product description to add either a custom product description or the manufacturer's.
Maintenance cost per period.
Support cost per period.
Notes on maintenance and support.
Reference to the maintenance and support invoice.
Import data into existing license custom fields. Supported custom field data types: Text, Date, Yes|No, Digit, Currency, Decimal.
